title: Introduction to simplecolors
text: function sc() stands simplecolors. base R, call colors need c("green", "blue") simplecolors similar sc() instead sc("green", "blue") key can add modifiers sc("brightgreen2", "mutedblue3") naming convention standardized: 4 types saturation, 8 hues, 5 levels lightness plus greyscale. use color, just combine 3 parts: default, outputs hex codes simplecolors can used anywhere can use hex code. rest tutorial ’m going show use package enhance color choices ggplot2. First, let’s look output base R colors. Although terms “lightblue” “navyblue” common ways talk lightness blue, call raw colors don’t “feel” go light dark.  Let’s see looks like sc() function  , just hex codes. code writing
code: sc("brightgreen2", "mutedblue3") #> "#8FFF8F" "#5E82C9" library(ggplot2) library(simplecolors)  p <-    ggplot(mpg, aes(y = drv, fill = drv)) +   geom_bar()    p + scale_fill_manual(values = c("lightblue", "blue", "navyblue")) p + scale_fill_manual(values = sc("blue2", "blue3", "blue4")) p + scale_fill_manual(values = c("#9DB9F1", "#4479E4", "#16439C"))

title: Introduction to simplecolors
text: hue ’s helper function. last example can simplified using sc_blue()  Like sc(), helper functions returns hex codes can adjust lightness saturation
code: p + scale_fill_manual(values = sc_blue(light = 2:4)) sc_blue(light = 2:4) #> "#9DB9F1" "#4479E4" "#16439C" p + scale_fill_manual(values = sc_violet(light = 3:5, sat = "dull"))

title: Introduction to simplecolors
text: can also go across palettes. Let’s use base R colors  call sc() sc("blue", "violet", "red") can also call first letter color using sc_across()  can brighten dull saturation argument sat = ...  can lighten darken argument light = ...  tried keep first initial color unique. example, chose “violet” “purple” didn’t compete “pink” getting around “green” “grey”. reason, must call grey “Gy”  can also use simplecolors make gradient
code: p + scale_fill_manual(values = c("blue", "purple", "red")) p + scale_fill_manual(values = sc_across("BVR")) p + scale_fill_manual(values = sc_across(palette = "BVR", sat = "bright")) p + scale_fill_manual(values = sc_across(palette = "BVR", light = 4)) p + scale_fill_manual(values = sc_across(palette = "BGyR")) library(dplyr)  ggplot(mpg, aes(cty, hwy, color = hwy)) +   geom_count(alpha = 0.8) +   scale_color_gradient(     low  = sc("brightorange3"),      high = sc("brightviolet3")   )

title: Introduction to simplecolors
text: palettes (sc_green(), sc_across(), etc.), can get info colors using return = ... argument.   table
